alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... NORTH CENTRAL KING WILLIAM AND SOUTH CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Aylett, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saint Stephens Church and Aylett around 615 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Biscoe, Central Garage, Rumford, Henley Fork, Turpin, Bruington, Upshaw, Walkerton, and Dunbrooke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
